summary: The Healthy Equipping And Lending Technical Help Panel Act (HEALTH Panel Act) amends the Congressional Budget and Impoundment Control Act of 1974 to establish a Panel of Health Advisors within the Congressional Budget Office (CBO). This panel, composed of 15 experts, will provide technical expertise and recommendations to the CBO on health and healthcare-related issues, helping to improve the office's studies, analysis, and cost estimates. The panel will meet annually, issue reports, and focus on areas like health care legislation cost estimates and the CBO's publications.
